00007 void RadioStateAnalogueModel::filterSignal(AirFrame *frame, const Coord& /*sendersPos*/, const Coord& /*receiverPos*/)
00008 {
00009   Signal&      signal     = frame->getSignal();
00010   RSAMMapping* attMapping = new RSAMMapping(this, signal.getReceptionStart(), signal.getReceptionEnd());
00011

00015 void RadioStateAnalogueModel::cleanUpUntil(simtime_t_cref t)
00016 {
00017   // assert that list is not empty
00018   assert(!radioStateAttenuation.empty());
00019 
00020   /* the list contains at least one element */
00021 
00022   // CASE: t is smaller or equal the timepoint of the first element ==> nothing to do, return
00023   if ( t <= radioStateAttenuation.front().getTime() )
00024   {
00025     return;
00026   }
00027 
00028 
00029   // CASE: t is greater than the timepoint of the last element
00030   // ==> clear complete list except the last element, return
00031   if ( t > radioStateAttenuation.back().getTime() )
00032   {
00033     ListEntry lastEntry = radioStateAttenuation.back();
00034     radioStateAttenuation.clear();
00035     radioStateAttenuation.push_back(lastEntry);
00036     return;
00037   }
00038 
00039   /*
00040    * preconditions from now on:
00041    * 1. list contains at least two elements, since 2. + 3.
00042    * 2. t > first_timepoint
00043    * 3. t <= last_timepoint
00044    */
00045 
00046   // get an iterator and set it to the first timepoint >= t
00047   std::list<ListEntry>::iterator it;
00048   it = lower_bound(radioStateAttenuation.begin(), radioStateAttenuation.end(), t);
00049 
00050 
00051   // CASE: list contains an element with exactly the given key
00052   if ( it->getTime() == t )
00053   {
00054     radioStateAttenuation.erase(radioStateAttenuation.begin(), it);
00055     return;
00056   }
00057 
00058   // CASE: t is "in between two elements"
00059   // ==> set the iterators predecessors time to t, it becomes the first element
00060   it--; // go back one element, possible since this one has not been the first one
00061 
00062   it->setTime(t); // set this elements time to t
00063   radioStateAttenuation.erase(radioStateAttenuation.begin(), it); // and erase all previous elements
00064 
00065 }
00066 
00067 void RadioStateAnalogueModel::writeRecvEntry(simtime_t_cref time, Argument::mapped_type_cref value)
00068 {
00069   // bugfixed on 08.04.2008
00070   assert( (radioStateAttenuation.empty()) || (time >= radioStateAttenuation.back().getTime()) );
00071 
00072   radioStateAttenuation.push_back(ListEntry(time, value));
00073 
00074   if (!currentlyTracking)
00075   {
00076     cleanUpUntil(time);
00077 
00078     assert(radioStateAttenuation.back().getTime() == time);
00079   }
00080 }

00084 
00085 Radio::Radio(int numRadioStates,
00086        bool recordStats,
00087        int initialState,
00088        Argument::mapped_type_cref minAtt, Argument::mapped_type_cref maxAtt,
00089        int currentChannel, int nbChannels):
00090   radioStates(), radioChannels(), state(initialState), nextState(initialState),
00091   numRadioStates(numRadioStates),
00092   swTimes(NULL),
00093   minAtt(minAtt), maxAtt(maxAtt),
00094   rsam(mapStateToAtt(initialState)),
00095   currentChannel(currentChannel), nbChannels(nbChannels)
00096 {
00097   assert(nbChannels > 0);
00098   assert(currentChannel > -1);
00099   assert(currentChannel < nbChannels);
00100 
00101   radioStates.setName("RadioState");
00102   radioStates.setEnabled(recordStats);
00103   radioStates.record(initialState);
00104   radioChannels.setName("RadioChannel");
00105   radioChannels.setEnabled(recordStats);
00106   radioChannels.record(currentChannel);
00107 
00108   // allocate memory for one dimension
00109   swTimes = new simtime_t* [numRadioStates];
00110 
00111   // go through the first dimension and
00112   for (int i = 0; i < numRadioStates; i++)
00113   {
00114     // allocate memory for the second dimension
00115     swTimes[i] = new simtime_t[numRadioStates];
00116   }
00117 
00118   // initialize all matrix entries to 0.0
00119   for (int i = 0; i < numRadioStates; i++)
00120   {
00121     for (int j = 0; j < numRadioStates; j++)
00122     {
00123       swTimes[i][j] = 0;
00124     }
00125   }
00126 }
00127 
00128 Radio::~Radio()
00129 {
00130   // delete all allocated memory for the switching times matrix
00131   for (int i = 0; i < numRadioStates; i++)
00132   {
00133     delete[] swTimes[i];
00134   }
00135 
00136   delete[] swTimes;
00137   swTimes = 0;
00138 }
00139 
00140 simtime_t Radio::switchTo(int newState, simtime_t_cref now)
00141 {
00142   // state to switch to must be in a valid range, i.e. 0 <= newState < numRadioStates
00143   assert(0 <= newState && newState < numRadioStates);
00144 
00145   // state to switch to must not be SWITCHING
00146   assert(newState != SWITCHING);
00147 
00148 
00149   // return error value if newState is the same as the current state
00150   // if (newState == state) return -1;
00151 
00152   // return error value if Radio is currently switching
00153   if (state == SWITCHING) return -1;
00154 
00155 
00156   /* REGULAR CASE */
00157 
00158 
00159   // set the nextState to the newState and the current state to SWITCHING
00160   nextState = newState;
00161   int lastState = state;
00162   state = SWITCHING;
00163   radioStates.record(state);
00164 
00165   // make entry to RSAM
00166   makeRSAMEntry(now, state);
00167 
00168   // return matching entry from the switch times matrix
00169   return swTimes[lastState][nextState];
00170 }
00171 
00172 void Radio::setSwitchTime(int from, int to, simtime_t_cref time)
00173 {
00174   // assert parameters are in valid range
00175   assert(time >= 0.0);
00176   assert(0 <= from && from < numRadioStates);
00177   assert(0 <= to && to < numRadioStates);
00178 
00179   // it shall not be possible to set times to/from SWITCHING
00180   assert(from != SWITCHING && to != SWITCHING);
00181 
00182 
00183   swTimes[from][to] = time;
00184   return;
00185 }
00186 
00187 void Radio::endSwitch(simtime_t_cref now)
00188 {
00189   // make sure we are currently switching
00190   assert(state == SWITCHING);
00191 
00192   // set the current state finally to the next state
00193   state = nextState;
00194   radioStates.record(state);
00195 
00196   // make entry to RSAM
00197   makeRSAMEntry(now, state);
00198 
00199   return;
00200 }

00202 RSAMConstMappingIterator::RSAMConstMappingIterator( const RadioStateAnalogueModel* rsam,
00203                                                     simtime_t_cref                 signalStart,
00204                                                     simtime_t_cref                 signalEnd )
00205   : ConstMappingIterator()
00206   , rsam(rsam)
00207   , it()
00208   , position()
00209   , nextPosition()
00210   , signalStart(signalStart)
00211   , signalEnd(signalEnd)
00212 {
00213   assert(rsam);
00214 
00215   assert( !(signalStart < rsam->radioStateAttenuation.front().getTime()) );
00216 
00217   jumpToBegin();
00218 }
00219 
00220 void RSAMConstMappingIterator::jumpTo(const Argument& pos)
00221 {
00222   // extract the time-component from the argument
00223   simtime_t_cref t = pos.getTime();
00224 
00225   assert( !(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.empty()) &&
00226       !(t < rsam->radioStateAttenuation.front().getTime()) );
00227 
00228   // current position is already correct
00229   if( t == position.getTime() )
00230     return;
00231 
00232   // this automatically goes over all zero time switches
00233   it = upper_bound(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.begin(), rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end(), t);
00234 
00235   --it;
00236   position.setTime(t);
00237   setNextPosition();
00238 }
00239 
00240 void RSAMConstMappingIterator::setNextPosition()
00241 {
00242   if (hasNext()) // iterator it does not stand on last entry and next entry is before signal end
00243   {
00244     if(position.getTime() < signalStart) //signal start is our first key entry
00245     {
00246       nextPosition.setTime(signalStart);
00247     } else
00248     {
00249       CurrList::const_iterator it2 = it;
00250       it2++;
00251 
00252       assert(it->getTime() <= position.getTime() && position.getTime() < it2->getTime());
00253 
00254       //point in time for the "pre step" of the next real key entry
00255       simtime_t_cref preTime = MappingUtils::pre(it2->getTime());
00256 
00257       if(position.getTime() == preTime) {
00258         nextPosition.setTime(it2->getTime());
00259       }
00260       else {
00261         nextPosition.setTime(preTime);
00262       }
00263     }
00264 
00265   } else // iterator it stands on last entry or next entry whould be behind signal end
00266   {
00267     nextPosition.setTime(position.getTime() + 1);
00268   }
00269 
00270 }
00271 
00272 void RSAMConstMappingIterator::iterateTo(const Argument& pos)
00273 {
00274   // extract the time component from the passed Argument
00275   simtime_t_cref t = pos.getTime();
00276 
00277   // ERROR CASE: iterating to a position before (time) the beginning of the mapping is forbidden
00278   assert( !(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.empty()) &&
00279       !(t < rsam->radioStateAttenuation.front().getTime()) );
00280 
00281   assert( !(t < position.getTime()) );
00282 
00283   // REGULAR CASES:
00284   // t >= position.getTime();
00285 
00286   // we are already exactly there
00287   if( t == position.getTime() )
00288     return;
00289 
00290   // we iterate there going over all zero time switches
00291   iterateToOverZeroSwitches(t);
00292 
00293   // update current position
00294   position.setTime(t);
00295   setNextPosition();
00296 
00297 }
00298 
00299 bool RSAMConstMappingIterator::inRange() const
00300 {
00301   simtime_t_cref t             = position.getTime();
00302   simtime_t_cref lastEntryTime = std::max(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.back().getTime(), signalStart);
00303 
00304   return  signalStart <= t
00305       && t <= signalEnd
00306       && t <= lastEntryTime;
00307 
00308 }
00309 
00310 bool RSAMConstMappingIterator::hasNext() const
00311 {
00312   assert( !(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.empty()) );
00313 
00314   CurrList::const_iterator it2 = it;
00315   if (it2 != rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end())
00316   {
00317     it2++;
00318   }
00319 
00320   return  position.getTime() < signalStart
00321       || (it2 != rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end() && it2->getTime() <= signalEnd);
00322 }
00323 
00324 void RSAMConstMappingIterator::iterateToOverZeroSwitches(simtime_t_cref t)
00325 {
00326   if( it != rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end() && !(t < it->getTime()) )
00327   {
00328     // and go over (ignore) all zero-time-switches, to the next greater entry (time)
00329     while( it != rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end() && !(t < it->getTime()) )
00330       ++it;
00331 
00332     // go back one step, here the iterator 'it' is placed right
00333     --it;
00334   }
00335 }
00336 
00337 RSAMMapping::argument_value_t RSAMMapping::getValue(const Argument& pos) const
00338 {
00339   // extract the time-component from the argument
00340   simtime_t_cref t = pos.getTime();
00341 
00342   // assert that t is not before the first timepoint in the RSAM
00343   // and receiving list is not empty
00344   assert( !(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.empty()) &&
00345       !(t < rsam->radioStateAttenuation.front().getTime()) );
00346 
00347   /* receiving list contains at least one entry */
00348 
00349   // set an iterator to the first entry with timepoint > t
00350   std::list<RadioStateAnalogueModel::ListEntry>::const_iterator it;
00351   it = upper_bound(rsam->radioStateAttenuation.begin(), rsam->radioStateAttenuation.end(), t);
00352 
00353   // REGULAR CASE: it points to an element that has a predecessor
00354   --it; // go back one entry, this one is significant!
00355 
00356   return it->getValue();
00357 }
00358 
00359 ConstMappingIterator* RSAMMapping::createConstIterator(const Argument& pos) const
00360 {
00361   RSAMConstMappingIterator* rsamCMI
00362     = new RSAMConstMappingIterator(rsam, signalStart, signalEnd);
00363 
00364   rsamCMI->jumpTo(pos);
00365 
00366   return rsamCMI;
00367 }
